The movement of plants could lead to the displacement of animals, as they would have to adapt to the changing environment.
Plants could potentially become more invasive, as they could spread more quickly and outcompete native species.
The movement of plants could lead to changes in the structure and composition of ecosystems, as they would be able to move and alter the landscape in ways that were previously not possible.
Plants could potentially become more efficient at capturing and utilizing resources, as they would be able to move to areas with more abundant resources.
The movement of plants could lead to changes in the distribution of species, as they would be able to move and colonize new areas.
